name: Kepler-219
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-219 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-219 is a star with 1.9249999999999994 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.49 times its radius. It is located 2626.53 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-219 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-219 b

Kepler-219 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.59 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-219.

The mass of Kepler-219 b is 12.88 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-219 b is 2.95 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-219 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-219 c

Kepler-219 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 22.71 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-219.

The mass of Kepler-219 c is 20.48 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-219 c is 3.58 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-219 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-219 d

Kepler-219 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.27 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 47.90 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-219.

The mass of Kepler-219 d is 11.52 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-219 d is 2.81 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-219 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-219, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
